data.title: fix a problem where WebSocket messages may pile up

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
In the original implementation, only one message (frame) will be processed per tick, so the WebSocket messages will pile up if server sends them faster than client's frame rate.
Fixed by processing all messages in the queue in one update.

data.title: Enhance ScrollView with easing out scrolling

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
Enhance ScrollView with elastic scroll movement.

It becomes to have iOS-like bounce-back and elastic inertia scroll using exponential ease out of tween functions.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WwYJBN1bke4

It might seem that much part of sources are changed. But it is mainly resulted by code refactoring which removed some duplicated logics. No public / protected interfaces are changed and it works well with existing components.
- No attributes related to Cocos Studio are changed.
- No protected interfaces used by ListView and PageView are changed. They are not changed and work well.
- Improved maintainability. Source refactoring is done and have compact codes.
- Test project works fine.

data.title: Allow optional custom logging function.
data.body: Allowing the setting of an optional custom logging function means all cocos2d-x logging messages can be processed by the game, thereby allowing low-level errors to be visible to crash reporting frameworks, for example.

data.title: VS2013 An invalid parameter was passed to a service or function.
data.body:
I'm using win7 with Visual studio 2013 update 3, tried it on template cpp project, with no other addition.

Compile success, but got error when running the application:
"An invalid parameter was passed to a service or function."

Is it bug?

data.title: Set DEBUG_MODE on or off based on CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE
data.body: When setting the CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE with Cmake parameter the setting gets overwritten by the option in cocos2d/CMakeLists.txt. With this, If the developer specifies that it should be a release build with `-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo` or `-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release` DEBUG_MODE is set to OFF, other wise it stays on because it's the default value in cocos2d/CMakeLists.txt.

data.title: [ci skip]UIRichTextTest:Fixed text don't render properly in the Windows 8.1 Store App.
Update README.md: Initialize all submodules after cloning
data.body:
This change allows the user to clone and initialize the submodules in one step instead of two separate. 

**man git-clone**

```
--recursive, --recurse-submodules
       After the clone is created, initialize all submodules within, using their default settings. This is equivalent to running git submodule update --init --recursive immediately after the clone is finished. 
```

The missing labels for the 150x150 Start Screen icon were added.

data.title: Capured image with RenderTexture loses quality
I change a file in Resources but it does not have an effect on Windows
data.body:
Formerly when I was using cocos2d-x 3.2 the files were looked in Resources folder for windows applications. Hence, when I had a configuration file with game settings I could easily change some values and re-run the game and see what is changed. But now in cocos2d-x 3.5 the content of Resources is copied into `proj.win32/Debug.win32` during Pre-Link Event which in Visual Studio is setup as follows:

`xcopy "$(ProjectDir)..\Resources" "$(OutDir)" /D /E /I /F /Y`

Hence when I change .plist of .json file and re-run game without rebuilding it does not take effect - old resources are being used. The same is for graphics and shaders and it is very painful each time to delete from `proj.win32/Debug.win32` and also change a line in a source code to get it recompiled on run and copied the files into `proj.win32/Debug.win32`. Please address this extreme unhandy behavior.

More details here: http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/i-change-a-file-in-resources-but-it-does-not-have-an-effect-on-windows/21067
